newsitem.title: THAILAND: Union Asia details new share issue.
newsitem.headline: Union Asia details new share issue.

text.p: Thailand's Union Asia Finance and Securities Plc said it will float 40.6 million shares to existing shareholders through a two-for-one rights issue at 10 baht each.
The rights issue is part of the company's capital increase plan which had been approved by its shareholders in April 1993, Union Asia said in a filing to the Stock Exchange of Thailand.
In 1993, Union Asia said it would raise its registered capital to two billion baht ($76.9 million) from 800 million baht by issuing 120 million new shares.
Union Asia currently has paid-up capital of 812.3 million baht, it said.
The proceeds from the rights issue will help increase the company's working capital, it said.
